Rolycoly (Japanese: タンドン Tandon) is a Rock-type Pokémon introduced in Generation VIII.

It evolves into Carkol starting at level 18, which evolves into Coalossal starting at level 34.

Biology

Rolycoly is a Pokémon which resembles a small piece of coal. It has a single orange-red eye that can light up and illuminate dark areas,[1] while the rest of its body is black. It has a rugged exterior and lacks any limbs. Its lower body has a wheel-like leg, which it rolls on and uses for movement, in a similar fashion to a unicycle.

Rolycoly was first discovered around 400 years ago in coal mines. It races around on grassy plains and the rough, rocky terrain in coal mines and caves, burning through the coal that sustains it. Rolycoly's diet also includes grass that gets tangled in its leg. Until about 100 years ago, every household in Galar had a Rolycoly, using the coal that it drops for cooking and heating up homes. Rolycoly's popularity continues even into the modern-day, as it is used for outdoor activities.[1] Dwebble is Rolycoly's natural enemy, as the former tends to think that Rolycoly is an inanimate rock to turn into a home.

Rolycoly and its evolved forms are the only known Pokémon that can have Steam Engine as an Ability.

Evolution

Rolycoly evolves into Carkol, which evolves into Coalossal.

(For specifics on this Pokémon's Evolution in the games, refer to Game data→Evolution data.)

Pokédex entries

This Pokémon was unavailable prior to Generation VIII.
Generation VIII Galar
#161 		Galar
Crown Tundra #176 		Sinnoh
#— 		Hisui
#—
This Pokémon has no Pokédex entries in Brilliant Diamond, Shining Pearl, and Legends: Arceus.
Sword Most of its body has the same composition as coal. Fittingly, this Pokémon was first discovered in coal mines about 400 years ago.
Shield It can race around like a unicycle, even on rough, rocky terrain. Burning coal sustains it.
Generation IX Paldea
#91 		Kitakami
#— 		Blueberry
#—
Scarlet On sunny days, Rolycoly will come out onto grassy plains and roll around. Then it will eat the grass that gets tangled in its wheel-like leg.
Violet Chunks of the surface of this Pokémon's body that have grown old and flaked off have long been used for fuel as an alternative to coal.


Rolycoly in the Paldea Pokédex

In animation

Main series

Major appearances

Rolycoly debuted in Kabu's Battle Training!, under the ownership of Wakaba. It teamed up with Kabu's Centiskorch in a Tag Battle against Liko and Roy.

Minor appearances

A Trainer's Rolycoly appeared in Tinkatink's Ideal Hammer.

In the manga

Pokémon Adventures

A Dynamaxed Rolycoly appeared in Shock!! Chairman Rose's Plan during the Darkest Day.

In the TCG

Main article: Rolycoly (TCG)

Trivia

  • Rolycoly and its evolved forms have several unique distinctions:
    • Rolycoly is the only Pokémon that is not Fire-type to have access to the Ability Flash Fire.
    • They are the only black Rock-type Pokémon.
  • Rolycoly and its evolved forms share their category with Torkoal. They are all known as the Coal Pokémon.
  • Rolycoly has the lowest base stat total of all Rock-type Pokémon.

Origin

Rolycoly may be based on coal and a wheel. Its Shiny variant's gray coloration may reference how coal turns white with ash as it burns.

Name origin

Rolycoly may be a combination of roly-poly and coal. It may also be a pun on rolling coal.

Tandon may be a combination of 炭 tan (coal) and どん don (bang).

In other languages
